meanings.definition: Of or occurring in the morning.
meanings.sent1: The matutinal sun gently woke up the sleepy town.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy the matutinal breeze during my morning walks.
meanings.sent3: The matutinal birds sang a cheerful tune to start the day.
meanings.sent4: Her matutinal routine was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The matutinal light filtered through the curtains, signaling the start of a new day.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the morning.
meanings.sent1: The matutinal dew glistened on the grass at dawn.
meanings.sent2: His matutinal cup of coffee was a daily ritual.
meanings.sent3: The matutinal mist enveloped the landscape in a dreamy haze.
meanings.sent4: The matutinal calm of the morning was interrupted by a loud noise.
meanings.sent5: The matutinal colors of the sunrise painted the sky in hues of pink and gold.

meanings.definition: Happening or appearing in the morning.
meanings.sent1: The matutinal delivery of the newspaper was always on time.
meanings.sent2: The matutinal joggers greeted each other with a smile.
meanings.sent3: The matutinal market bustled with activity as vendors set up their stalls.
meanings.sent4: The matutinal mist slowly lifted to reveal a stunning view.
meanings.sent5: The matutinal train whistle echoed through the valley, signaling the start of a new day.
